description: [Status: stable] [Name: invalid-escape-sequence] [Message: Invalid escape sequence: \{ch}] What it does Checks for invalid escape sequences. Why is this bad? Invalid escape sequences are deprecated in Python 3.6. Example regex = "\.png$" Use instead: regex = r"\.png$" Or, if the string already contains a valid escape sequence: value = "new line\nand invalid escape \_ here" Use instead: value = "new line\nand invalid escape \\_ here"
